text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Morocco asks United Nations Security Council to resume proceedings for referendum in Western Sahara.
- Rabat hosts 20th session of council of governors of Arab central banks and monetary agencies.
- Five die and six are injured in road crash in central city of Khenifra.
- French drug trafficker, arrested last July, to appeal against sentence on Sept 18.
- More than 12 million voters go to polls to decide on constitutional reform.
- Morocco cuts interest rates on public treasury bond issues.
- EU to impose import licences and bank guarantees to protect markets from Moroccan oranges.
